metadata.title: CVE-2020-22025 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability exists in gaussian_blur atlibavfilter/vf_edgedetect.c, which might lead to memory corruption andother potential consequences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-22025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavdevice59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra8 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter8 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat59 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavutil57 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libpostproc56 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswresample4 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswscale6 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
